intro: Ouratea laxiflora, commonly known as the slender ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptic to ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Ouratea laxiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
